186042826.review:
Don't buy it. 
It's another factory of farming, wasting time, and damaging nerves. There are so few resources that you can survive, just survive, and not want to leave the game. But not so many to get satisfaction from playing. All the time on the edge. You will only be able to create something after the first 50-70 hours of wild, nerve-wracking farming. And a lot of illogical mechanics. Probably, an "improvement" store will appear in the game soon. It feels like the developer is from Ubisoft. The only thing missing is NFT.
After each death, and there will be a lot of them at the beginning, you have to run "naked" for at least 5 minutes across 2/3 of the map to recover your resources and not loose them.

Respect yourself and your time. Do not encourage the development of such farms.

p.s.
I just noticed that "enhancements" are already available for purchase on steem for a "small but fair penny". Where are the NFTs?

185999254.review: Subsistence is a difficult and time consuming game, for me this is part of why I find it so fun. There is a lot of challenge, to survive the elements and predators in nature while trying to gather the resources necessary to further improve your base, weapons and means of generating resources to survive. The addition of hunters into the game that actively attack you and your base, adds an objective for you to improve your base to add defence and to improve your weapons so that you can hunt the hunters. The game has many features both small and large which adds challenge and enjoyment. This isn't a game you can play for 10 minutes at a time so if your looking for a "quick" game, this isn't it but if your into a difficult survival, then this is it.

185759104.review:
I'm no slouch when it comes to survival games and wonky combat, But wow never in my wildest dreams would i have thought i could actually have pure hatred for fighting anything in a survival game.

wolfs an bears on normal the spawns are stupid as hell, walk 100 feet poof a bear 50 feet away from a wolf ok walk the other way to find some nails to start a base nope wolfs and bears perfectly placed like a soccer goal net. ok will just try eveything i can to not get seen walk up a little hill wolf yeets him self 20feet in the air and mauls me.

These animals are like a mutated super bear/wolfs.

okay try it on easy nope walking around gather enough nails to almost build a single foundation wolfs or bears spawn and see you easily and super sayian mafia jump you, ok i'll just get must stuff and retry building a base ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ NOPE! because now the game yeets me 1000meters or more away from where i died, and trekking through this map with these super sayian mafia jumping wolfs an bears is down right Asinine.

trying to kill anything in here is like hitting a concrete/meat filled sack with legs and teeth that leap and run like a super sayian, And all that while hitting it with a aluminum foil fork. so i think oh a gun will do find some more ammo shoot the wolf 5 times out of the 7 bullets just to kill a wolf with a 9mm gun wtf. okay the axe will do better i bet nope smash the ♥♥♥♥ out of a wolf or bear in the face like 3 to 5 times and its like you just hit it with a feather duster.

This games animals is completely Asinine i get this is not a hunting simulator, But my god for the love of survival games and any sort of semblence of combat please fix these BS predator animals. its just immense tedium that doesn't actually offer anything to immersion or gameplay.

most of the animations of the animals when they turn their bodies is just god awful please improve that.

also why does my character need a entire home depot of nails to create a foundation This is completely out of touch with the idea of surviving on the land and having to build a base out of what you have at the start, Maybe mid to late game when you have a basic base some more food water a bed to spawn back to in case you die from the {super sayian mafia kung fu fighters called animal predators} Then mid to late game after establishing your self with basic necessities you can start working your way towards getting or crafting nails to make better quality foundations.

Also dropping down off a say 2 foot drop to a 6 foot drop my character dies instantly like he or she got yeeted through the universe at mach jesus through space and time to then rag doll and splatter from hitting a planet like a bug on a wind shield.

i understand your only one person working on this, i will continue to try my best to drudge through this game, But wow dude please adjust an improve these things i have mentioned.

185750208.review:
2025年1月時点で、リソース関連はとりあえずプレイに『ぎりぎり』耐えられる仕様になりつつあるので、改善点要望としては以下。

・銃のストッピングパワーが皆無なので違和感しかない（ショットガン当たってんのにスーパーアーマーで突っ込んでくる狼とか現実的におかしい）。着弾したらコンマ何秒獣が止まるとか簡単な調整はしてほしい。モーションとかまで求めないから。

・製作陣が少数かつアンリアルエンジンなんだから、ＭＯＤ開放しろって。インディーゲームはだいたい有志ＭＯＤで助けられてるんだから。まともな有料ＤＬコンテンツないんだからモッダーに助けてもらえって。

・エイムがおかしい。ゲームのクセというならゴッドモード用意してこのゲームのエイム練習させてくれ。
あとようわからん武器カスタムよりスコープなりレザポなり実装してくれ……。

・散々言われてるが、同種の耐久値ある果物とかをスタックすると一個目に入手したアイテムの耐久値に二個目以降のアイテムも削られるのはバグだから直して。暫定回避策としてスタックする仕様オフにすりゃいいだけだから。モッダーが一瞬で直してくれるわこんなもん。

売上伸ばしたいなら上の事絶対やったほうがええて。ようわからんロープウェイアプデより一時間テストプレイすりゃわかる部分が直されていないのに杜撰さを感じる。

185416858.review:
If you are a gluten for self punishment, this is the game for you.  Survival isn't survival unless one allows themselves to be immersed in the experience of Subsistence.  I personally like this game.  It feels really good to spend hours gathering limited resources only to be offed by a wolf, bear, or mountain lion. You will only need to trek miles in the freezing cold in predator infested forests to get back to your bag which is guarded by the beast that has slain you.  Oh, and did I mention that the animal gets leveled up after ending your day?  No worries, once that adorable kitty cat ends you again, you will then trek another few miles back dying of hypothermia, starvation, or by the hand of other happy hunters in the forest only to find the kitty leveled up to smack you again.  I spent hours building up an awesome base after grinding for limited resources only for my neighbors to visit me locked an loaded.  They will proceed to destroy everything you built and not give a care in the world about your feelings after doing so. Once they burn your shelter to smoldering ashes, you will be surprised to find everything you built is gone once you have again treked miles back to your base avoiding the animals and elements.  You might even run into the kitty cat again who will slap you in the face and level up once you have become his feces. Did I mention you lose half your items in your bag upon death? 

Yup. This is true survival.  This is pure unadulterated punishment.  The computer gets all of the perks and benefits while you bask in pure humiliation.  I recommend this little gem if you love a challenge. By challenge, I mean you will be destroyed.  You will sink hours into this game in the hopes of proving your skills only to have your dream shattered.  You will come into this world so optimistic and ready. Then Yogi will show up, slap your bottom into submission, then level up upon your inevitable demise. You will try to fish only for a majestic eagle to come and steal your meal after gathering rare resources to build and use your rod.  Yes, the game will feed upon your labor and you will thank it for it.  

This game is best played with friends for optimal enjoyment.  Hearing your bestie rage into the microphone while you are running for your life from a ravenous wolf is a memory you will treasure for life. One minute they are collecting fibers, the next they die of dehydration and lose half of all the resources they worked so hard to collect.  You and your friends will trauma bond through this game.  

Hope this helps!!

185412791.review:
I broke my own rule with this game.  NEVER PLAY ANYTHING IN EARLY ACCESS.  The games always just lack polish, and are generally unfun.  It tends to push me away from an otherwise potentially enjoyable game.

At this point, this is exactly the situation that has taken place with this game here.

The game has some good points, but it needs a great deal of work.

It has a basic crafting and base building system.

It needs them to be far, far more advanced.  It needs a leveling system for the player and I personally would like a skill tree to distinguish myself with other players.

All that believe it or not i feel is in the games positive column as its what the game could add to immediately improve it.

For starters even playing with this a buddy there is no team play aspect despite this being sold as a coop game.  There is no way to establish a party, there is no way to simply trade items one player to another, it all must be dropped.

The early game is terrible, absolutely terrible.  Animals are literally everywhere, literally everywhere.  One predator, even a low level one is fully capable of killing your entire team.  For one the default "weapon" they give you is pathetic and you struggle to even hit the target if its a smaller enemy.  And the larger ones?  Kill you in a single hit.

When you respawn you respawn in a RANDOM area completely away from your team and takes forever to get back to where you've established a base. You can build some things to allow you to respawn but those things take way too damn long to find and build.

Surviving your first night is often times impossible and in some cases just starting a game even during the day you will start to die cause its too cold.

They give you no instruction for where to find all the rate resources you need, I assume you are meant to look for random crates to secure the materials but none of this is told to you by the game and even if you did find them while looting them you can still be ambushed and one shot by literally any animal in the game.

One the positive side the game does have a clear UI.

But on it lacks a great deal of customization options, and the player avatars look very dated, dare i say horrible.

Keep this game in your sights, it could turn out great, but it needs a lot of work.  Anybody telling me I didn't play this game enough should realize that I've played minutes below the steam return policy.  Anybody picking this up with a buddy, is likely to have the same experience as me.

185265082.review:
"Survivalvalcraft" should involve [i]crafting.[/i]

The genre isn't called "survivallootcrates."

If you enjoy wandering around aimlessly looking for crates while animals that level up every time they kill you continue to kill you blocking access to all your dropped packs, while trying to tell the difference between the 1-2 bushes per square km  that you can harvest for food or fiber from and the 78655689737390 bushes that are not even interactable, but seemingly just for aesthetics, then this might be your game.

If you enjoy being repeatedly killed by the same animal over and over, who then gains levels, making it impossible for you to kill IT, who camps your gear after killing you, this might also be your game.

If you enjoy survivalcraft games though, this probably isn't your jam.

184831862.review:
Das Spiel ist mit das anspruchsvollste welches ich bisher aus diesem Genre gespielt habe. Am Anfang wird es einem wirklich nicht leicht gemacht und es kann schnell frustrierend sein von einem einfachen Wolf getötet zu werden und wenns blöd läuft 15 min über die ganze Map zu laufen um sein Zeug wieder zubekommen.

WENN man jedoch seine Base errichtet hat, sich mit den Spielmechaniken auseinandergesetzt und bereit ist viel zu grinden, 
DANN ist das Spiel ein wahres Juwel und man kann Stunden damit zubringen eine tolle handgemachte Spielwelt zu entdecken.  

Sehr zu empfehlen ist das Spiel im Multiplayer da das grinden leichter fällt und man gemeinsam besser gegen die Jäger besteht. Außerdem macht zusammenzocken immer mehr bock.

184672554.review: Игра с очень плохим балансом. По крайней мере на начальном этапе все завязано на лутание ящиков. Без этого не выполнить даже стартовый квест по постройке базы. Не подохнуть очень сложно даже на легком уровне сложности. Местность густо заселена хищниками. Стартовым пистолетом можно убить волка если только очень повезет, медведя совсем никак :).  Если сгрыз хищник, то скорее всего будет потеря всего лута: время жизни выпавшего с игрока добра ограничено, а хищник будет убивать снова и снова, при этом прокачиваясь и становясь сильнее (моя ситуация в первую попытку игры).  Когда я таки убил волка (судорожно стреляя пистолетом как из пулемета) из него выпал один кусочек мяса, который после готовки добавил на удивление мало сытости. При голоде игра рекомендует собирать водоросли, которые добавляют совсем ничего. Приготовленной рыбки хватило буквально на пару минут. В общем, с таким балансом, геймплей примерно таков(если не сгрызут):  дохнешь от голода на базе, затем бежишь обратно из рандомной точки и собираешь лутбоксы. Подбираешь вещи с трупа, что-нибудь строишь, потом опять дохнешь и заново.  Ресурсов на постройку тоже нужно много, и опять таки - гвозди из лутбоксов. В общем, "веселье". И это я еще не дожил до нападений злодеев (видимо, с таким балансом это просто дополнительный источник смертей).

184438534.review:
La idea es buena, pero el resultado no. 

Desarrollado en DirectX9.0 no cumple mis expectativas visuales. Tampoco la mecánica me convence. Por ejemplo, talar un árbol y que se quede ahí. A mi imaginación queda que lo haya cortado. En el tema de crafteo, tengo otro problema. Si quiero armar algo básico, suele tener 3 componentes. Uno se consigue mediante esfuerzo y los otros dos, pateando el mapa y teniendo suerte que un animal no me haga pedazos. Nunca vi lobos tan resistentes a las balas. A mi me sale que es un juego de más looteo y suerte. Yo esperaba algo más tirando a la mecánica de NOD.

En resumen, la idea es buena. Las actualizaciones muestran que no se trata de abandonaware, y si tienes un PC con pocas posibilidades, sin duda este irá bien con tu dinosaurio.

184310285.review:
Ein Survival-Game, das den Titel - sagen wir mal - nur bedingt verdient.
Ich habe mir einige Let's-Plays im Netz (YouTube) angeschaut und auch einige Rezensionen gelesen und kann bestätigen, das dies ein ultraschweres Game ist.
Allerdings möchte ich an dieser Stelle erwähnen, daß das Verhältnis Anstrengung & Rewards nicht "gerecht" sind. Auch die Preise für das Craften sind meiner Meinung nach viel zu hoch - da ist man ja mindestens 1 Jahr (oder so ähnlich) damit beschäftigt, eine Base mit den Maßen 3x3 zu erstellen - von Reperaturen oder Upgrades ganz zu schweigen...

Mein Fazit:
ich habe mir das Game bei Steam zwar gekauft, würrde es aber nicht noch einmal tun.

beste grüße

184290812.review:
Difficile quand on ne le connait pas (car pas grand chose de logique).

Le principal problème est le temps nécessaire pour construire le moindre truc.
N'espérez pas construire une belle base en 20h, il faudra plutôt compter sur 100 ou 200h... 

Quand on considère que le développeur est seul pour développer le jeu, le jeu est très complet, agréable et surtout il y a très peu de bugs.

Le jeu est mis à jour environ tous les 6 mois avec une grosse MAJ.

Le jeu est bien optimisé et propre, la communauté est très bonne (moyenne d'âge élevée).

184243713.review:
Je dit non et je m'explique, j'ai acheté ce jeu au mois de juin. Parfait le jeu est franchement bien rien à y redire mais depuis la dernière mise à jours impossible de lancer le JEU !!!!!

Il ce ferme juste après le logo, toute les manipulations inimaginable pour essayer de résoudre ce problème avec l'aide de personne super gentille n'as absolument rien changé au problème.

Vérifications des fichier, cache du jeu vidé, compatibilité windows, jeu désinstallé et ré installé, réinstallations des registres C+,pare feu et anti virus désactivé. etc

Rien à faire le jeu ne veux plus ce lancer, et je suis pas le seul a subir ce problème. 

Aucun message des développeurs.... franchement je paye un jeu et je veux pouvoir y jouer quand je le souhaites, là pour le coup j'ai perdu 13 euros. C'est dommage car le jeu est franchement bien.

184180924.review:
I like and have played several craft/survival games. This game however got the best of me. Maybe I'm just bad at the game mechanics...but I died, A LOT! Plus I made the mistake of placing my base about as far away from the spawn point as possible. So if the cold didn't kill me (which it did several times) then the beasts who had leveled up by killing me many times before...when a bear or a wolf etc, kills you, they level up. Thus tipping the balance so that as you're running back to your far away base for the 6th or 9th time, Mr. Bear, who has been the beneficiary of your inept game play, thanks you by easily targeting your frail and tattered (and very cold) frame with less effort than he did the many times before.
I did start the game over. And while I corrected many of my mistakes of the first foray, Unfortunately the cold, or the lack of food, or the plentiful beasts quickly put an end to my hard found enthusiasm. I'll wait until the developer realizes that some of us may need more options starting out like more berry bushes, (I died of malnutrition a lot), or more than just a pair of pants as beginning clothing. Staring down the barrel of my 9mm firearm and firing off all 14 of the bullets I managed to scrounge up still did not save me from my nemesis, the bear. He still killed me, and leveled up, once again.

184174422.review: cold. diseased. no stamina. starving. no ammunition. died. cant get loot because bears spawn camp it. cant go outside when its night.

184159049.review:
Subsistence starts with promise but quickly devolves into a grind-heavy, time-consuming slog that drains any sense of enjoyment. What could have been an immersive survival experience is overshadowed by the game’s punishing mechanics and tedious gameplay loop.

Gathering resources is an exhausting chore. Even basic tasks like chopping wood or hunting take forever, and the sheer amount of materials needed for crafting and base maintenance is absurd. You’ll spend hours just scraping together enough supplies for minor upgrades, making progression feel like a distant mirage rather than a rewarding journey.

The game demands so much micromanagement that it feels like a second job. From constantly scavenging for food and water to endlessly repairing your base, there’s no time to actually enjoy the world or explore beyond survival basics. The relentless grind doesn’t foster immersion—it creates frustration.

The AI hunters and wildlife add difficulty, but instead of enriching the experience, they just amplify the grind. Encounters are often unfair, depleting your hard-earned resources and setting you back even further. Progress is so slow and punishing that it feels like the game actively resents you for playing it.

Subsistence fails to strike a balance between challenge and enjoyment, making it a miserable experience for anyone who values their time. If you’re looking for a rewarding survival game, look elsewhere. Subsistence is a masterclass in how not to design progression.

184041421.review: Des incohérences , un temps fou pour progresser , mais dans l'ensemble plaisant à jouer .

183981269.review:
Normalerweise sammle ich gerne Ressourcen für meine Basis, habe auch kein Problem damit, wenn genug vorhanden sind und ich für "Anfangsressourcen" nicht tausend Kilometer rennen und suchen muss.
Um aber auch nur 1 Fundament zu setzen, braucht man schon viele Nägel, die man (zumindest anfangs) nur in Kisten findet, und jede Menge Fasern, die man praktisch für alles braucht und rar sind, Eine Buschansammlung bringt noch nicht mal genug Fasern für ein Tauwerk, man braucht aber schon 4 Tauwerk für ein Fundament. Dann rennt man herum um weitere zu suchen und fällt auch schon dem 1. Tier zum opfer und respawnt evtl. 1000 Meter weiter weg. 
Nahrung findet man so gut wie nicht. Wenn man Glück hat vllt. in einer Kiste. Also erleidet man auch schnell mal den Hungertod, weil man kein Essen findet. Schafft man es irgendwie an Fleisch zu kommen, verrottet das so dermaßen schnell - auch in gebratenem Zustand innerhalb eines Spieltages - das macht echt keinen Spaß. 
Also beim besten Willen, wir haben 3 Anläufe versucht und wir haben es jetzt aufgegeben. Das ist Frust pur. Wir haben noch nicht mal 1 fertiges Minihaus hinbekommen, ohne vorher 3 Mal zu verrecken.

183848470.review: En general es un buen juego, necesita ajustes en dos cosas: la IA, que progresa demasiado rápido y es súper agresiva, atacan en multitudes de bots y el loot, que es escaso. Con pequeños cambios en estos aspectos, el juego podría alcanzar su máximo potencial.

183787677.review:
"""Highly suggest experienced open world survival craft veterans give this a go. It'll definitely make you much better in other games""""
I would say that this is the ultimate test for those who play open world survival craft games. It is just as unforgiving as dayz. The reward for survival brings me back to the feeling of getting kills in red orchestra 2 for the first time. This is why I played it for 6 hours straight my first go. Massive dopamine rush. That being said, theres a lot of negative feedback for that reason. Its hard, theres no story but the one you make. Theres hunters that are just as screwed as you are. The animals kill you like real life ( you will see a mountain lion drag your corpse by the neck as it finds a place to eat you, a bear grab your corpse and crush your skull ) and you are just in a cluster fuck of a situation.  Luckily I got a copy for my best bud to play with and it made it much easier to live. Highly suggest experienced open world survival craft veterans give this a go, It'll definitely make you much better in other games
